line_1: States thrive or wither as moons wax and wane,
line_2: Ev'n as his will and his decrees ordain;

line_1: His hoary age sinks in the feeble wane
line_2: Of an inglorious, slighted, tedious reign.

line_1: When the moon is in the wane,
How he should make the Turkish crescent wane,
line_2: And choak Tibiscus with the slain;

line_1: To banish friends when fortune's on the wane?
line_2: That throng'd from dissipation's giddy train?

line_1: When the faint moon, yet ling'ring in her wane,
line_2: Hangs o'er the waters of the restless main.

line_1: When the faint moon, yet ling'ring in her wane,
line_2: Will to the deaf, cold elements complain,

line_1: When the faint moon, yet ling'ring in her wane,
line_2: And tell th' embosom'd grief, however vain,
As years their empire slowly gain,
